bibl.title: Dispatch from William Walker, April 23, 1861
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
<pb facs="20170615_105840"
To the Hon.
The Secretary of State U.S. America.
Sir,
I have honor to inform you that I have the keeping of some U. States property connected with th Commercial Agency of this place. It was be to in any care by the late Henry A Ford M.D. and has been in the Mission Store till the present time. About one month since I opened two of the boxes to see whether the climate may leave injusred the contents, I only inspected them enough ot know that neither climate or insects had touched them, + closed them as before. one box seemed to contain books + the other copying presor*. There is a third box (small) + . a package or book in a brown paper envelope. This property is a safe as the property if the Missions of the Ann. Board of Comissioner for Foreign Missions.
<pb facs="20170615_105843"
I write this simply to inform the Department of the condition og the property and its location.
As our latest dates from the United States are only to Feb. 6th, + not being entirely certain that your is the City of Washington. I enclose this to a friend + Member Eage. Bible House, Astor Place New York
Very Respectfully Yours W.Walker Missionary of A.B.C.F.M
